--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "d_isen" <mavenjones@h...> wrote:
> 
> hi all,
> I'm starting to get into working with NEAT, and I was just 
wondering 
> if anyone had any links to anything about the leaky integrator 
> neuron, as I'm having a hard time finding any useful information, 
> aside from that it useful in generating oscilliatory behavior.  
> thanks,
> David


Leaky integrator neurons are a very interesting type of neuron that 
both leaks a little activation and takes incoming activation at a 
different rate depending on a time constant.  In other words, they 
have temporal properties, so they can be used effectively for 
pattern generation.

Unfortunately, most papers that involve leaky integrator neurons 
don't bother to give the equation!  One exception is this one:

Jesper Blynel , Dario Floreano.  (2002)  Levels of Dynamics and 
Adaptive Behavior in Evolutionary Neural Controllers.  Proceedings 
of the Seventh International Conference on Simulation of Adaptive 
Behavior on From Animals to Animats.  p.272-281.

(I think that paper can be googled)

Tyler Streeter (who is on this list and works on the Verve biped 
walking project) has managed to put leaky integrator neurons into 
NEAT, so it can be done.  I'm checking with him right now whether 
that code will be available.

ken
